tweets.text:
Accompanied by the usual BS statements from the @EnvAgency "We do allow storm overflows to discharge exceptionally into chalk streams".

Last time I checked, which was last week, TW had been dumping sewage into the River Chess for the 6th day in a row. Exceptional? https://t.co/N2khh8uHfr

tweets.text:
Dear EA. The Chess does not reach 'Good' overall health.

Reason? According to your data, "Sewage discharge (continuous) Water Industry".

So much for allowing discharges "but only within the strict permit limits required to protect the water quality".

https://t.co/4DP5nBsia5

0900 1 Feb 2021 There are currently 17 flood warnings and 59 flood alerts across the South East. Stay safe at home if you can ‚Äì if you do need to head out, don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/2Ba2jOTTtT

This week üì¢ Join us online for a special panel event 'Reflections on UK rivers and aquatic ecosystems'üíß

Featuring speakers from @wessexwater, @nationaltrust, @EnvAgency and @NaturalEngland, plus @IPR_NickP and @WIRCBath @hofman22.

Register now https://t.co/ytlBUnfeRp üéüÔ∏è‚§µÔ∏è

We‚Äôre still busy demobilising or refuelling high volume pumps around the @EnvAgencyYNE patch following #stormchristoph In response to recent rainfall on already saturated ground we continue to deploy pumps to manage water levels.Please help to keep our teams safe to do their work https://t.co/Q5Yw01aTxX

Sat 139.1m above sea level #DronfieldDam is an @EnvAgencyYNE #FloodStorageReservoir which stores 88,200m3 of flood water.

Primarily protecting #Dronfield but offers benefits through #Sheffield, #Rotherham and #Doncaster through the use of upland storage.

(Vid from 1600 today) https://t.co/C3WSRPjvQY

Officers are investigating a blue discolouration to Northcliffe Dike near Shipley. This blue colour is thought to be caused by a trace dye, which would represent a low risk of harm to the environment. If you see a potential environmental hazard, report it to us on 0800 807060 https://t.co/Or8OV6N4EV

urls.title: Massive new flood gate fitted in York
urls.description: The new gate will be air-lifted in place as part of ¬£38 million Foss Barrier upgrade.

tweets.text:
The new flood gate has been lowered into position today, a milestone for our ¬£38m upgrade of the #Foss Barrier in #York, better protecting 1,200 homes. https://t.co/i7onQwEZAX 
@OliverHarmarEA @EnvAgency @CityofYork https://t.co/DyLPNPA0ei

This is one of the @EnvAgencyYNE #Reservoirs on the #RiverRother near #Chesterfield.

The levels have pretty much peaked across the top ends of the catchment after some heavy rain overnight and this morning.

Levels across the top & middle of the catchments have peaked & falling. https://t.co/3bTNg8hsUO

tweets.text: Very good meeting today with @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySE @AlanMakMP and @GillianKeegan regarding discharges into local harbours. Vital we use new legislation and requirements to crack this issue which is a key concern to so many people in Portsmouth and surrounding areas.

‚òîÔ∏èAs communities continue to recover from the aftermath of #StormChristoph, we are calling for the creation and restoration of nature rich wetlands in the UK to help stop repeats of this type of catastrophic #flooding. üí¶

urls.title: Thames Water discharging raw sewage into Buckinghamshire river
urls.description: River Chess Association say untreated sewage is causing untold harm to infant trout and other habitats

tweets.text:
This happened for 49 days straight last year, but on 14 Jan @EnvAgency chief @JamesBevanEA told MPs "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams", apparently unaware that they very much are

 üëè @PJennings88 @RiverChess 

https://t.co/xKhosdkuvZ

‚úÖ Waterside #Evesham reopen following earlier closure due to flooding

@worcscc @Wychavon @EnvAgencyMids

Good to see the article, there are a number of things that need to be corrected, as good as the picture is that is runoff not sewage, the @EnvAgency "allow" permitted & un-permitted sewage discharges into the @RiverChess & these groundwater ingress discharges are un-permitted. https://t.co/5KDG5ALPjP

tweets.text: Flood defences have been installed by the @EnvAgency along the Thames tow path #Weybridge #Surrey #RiverThames #Flooding #Weather https://t.co/5UqZ5ziBX2

@agricontract @EnvAgency This is before and after of the River Parrot in Somerset after they flooded in 2014. Just look at the extra water holding capacty. Maintenance still going on, Needless to say they‚Äôve not flooded since. @westyeo will fill you in. https://t.co/qrFWkko5nD

This is a huge result for #ClimateAdaptation. The River Otter has been trying to reconnect with its flood plain since 1812. This is partnered with a similar project in the Sa√¢ne Valley in France. If successful the model will be rolled out further. #RacetoResilience #adaptourworld https://t.co/LWKN3wdVG6

@EmmaHowardBoyd @CASsummit2021 @EnvAgency @flimsin @SaleemulHuq @WRIClimate @UKCRP_SPF @ukinnl @AdaptOurWorld @ClintonDevon @GCAdaptation @COP26 Northwich flood plain building site for Bellway Homes - it has flooded 3 times since development was approved by central Government after refusal by local council https://t.co/16QkDqJU2y

tweets.text:
Absolutely heart breaking letters written by the children of St Luke's about living with the disgusting smell coming from the landfill at Wally's Quarry. @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @BorisJohnson #stopthestink #capitoff
Are the @EnvAgency listening to us yet? https://t.co/6HgFv4C4Bu

@wheat_daddy @pastoralview @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo Yes. Basically, dredging like that makes a lot of voles homeless, but they will recover as the grass grows again.

But I am pretty sure that we could design ways of helping water voles over the sparse period after dredging.

@UnderwaterMedia @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE @JamesBevanEA Polluters are good like that. If they don't land it on the spawning grounds they kill ogg the invertebrates the fry need.
@UnderwaterMedia @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE @JamesBevanEA Well there's plenty of "fertiliser" going into it mate, so that'll help I'm sure.... üòî
@JorvikAngler @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE @JamesBevanEA Been looking it up, my goodness it nasty stuff, only a few hundred meters from the barbel spawning grounds too.
